Title: A multiplexed single-cell CRISPR screening platform enables systematic dissection of the unfolded protein response
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Perturb-seq is applied to dissect the mammalian unfolded protein response (UPR) using single and combinatorial CRISPR perturbations. Two genome-scale CRISPR interference (CRISPRi) screens identified genes whose repression perturbs ER homeostasis. Subjecting ∼100 hits to Perturb-seq enabled high-precision functional clustering of genes. These studies highlight the ability of Perturb-seq to dissect complex cellular responses.

Title:
Single-cell transcriptional changes associated with
drug tolerance and response to combination
therapies in cancer
Tissues: cell lines, patient tissue, mouse xenografts
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study uses scRNA-seq to demonstrate the existence of multiple cancer cell subpopulations within cell lines, xenograft tumors and patient tumors, exhibiting epigenetic changes and differential therapeutic sensitivity. They show analysis of identified markers using the LINCS database to predict and functionally validate small molecules that target selected drug tolerant cell populations. Overall, they describe the spectrum of changes associated with drug tolerance and inhibition of specific tolerant cell subpopulations with combination agents.

Title: Identifying transcriptional programs underlying cancer drug response with TraCe-seq
Tissues: lung and breast cancer cell lines PC9, MCF-10A, MDA-MB-231, NCI-H358, and NCI-H1373
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: By conducting clonal fitness mapping and scRNA-seq, the authors developed tracking differential clonal response by scRNA-seq (TraCe-seq). TraCe-seq is a method that captures at clonal resolution the origin, fate and differential early adaptive transcriptional programs of cells in a complex population in response to distinct treatments. They used TraCe-seq to benchmark how next-generation dual epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) inhibitor–degraders compare to standard EGFR kinase inhibitors in EGFR-mutant lung cancer cells.

Title: Pooled CRISPR screening with single-cell transcriptome readout
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study combines pooled CRISPR screening with single-cell RNA sequencing into a broadly applicable workflow, directly linking guide RNA expression to transcriptome responses in thousands of individual cells. A novel method for CRISPR droplet sequencing (CROP-seq) enables pooled CRISPR screens with single-cell transcriptome resolution.

Title: Ultra-high-throughput single-cell RNA sequencing and perturbation screening with combinatorial fluidic indexing
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: To enable cost-effective single-cell sequencing for millions of individual cells, the authors developed ‘single-cell combinatorial fluidic indexing’ (scifi), combining one-step combinatorial preindexing of entire transcriptomes inside permeabilized cells with subsequent single-cell RNA-seq. Preindexing allows to overload droplet with multiple cells and computationally demultiplex their individual expression profiles, thereby increasing throughput massively. They applied scifi-RNA-seq in a highly multiplexed CRISPR screen with single-cell transcriptome readout of T cell receptor activation.

Title: Perturb-Seq: Dissecting Molecular Circuits with Scalable Single-Cell RNA Profiling of Pooled Genetic Screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This papers introduces Perturb-seq by analyzing 200,000 cells in immune cells and cell lines, focusing on transcription factors regulating the response of dendritic cells to lipopolysaccharide (LPS). Perturb-seq combines single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) and clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats (CRISPR)-based perturbations to perform many such assays in a pool.

Title: Multimodal pooled Perturb-CITE-seq screens in patient models define mechanisms of cancer immune evasion
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: In this study, the authors developed Perturb-CITE-sequencing (Perturb-CITE-seq), enabling pooled clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeat (CRISPR)–Cas9 perturbations with single-cell transcriptome and protein readouts. They profiled transcriptomes and 20 proteins in ~218,000 cells under ~750 perturbations associated with cancer cell-intrinsic immune checkpoint inhibitor resistance (ICR) in patient-derived melanoma cells and autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) co-cultures. This work provides a framework for the deciphering of complex mechanisms by large-scale perturbation screens with multimodal, single-cell readouts, and discovers potentially clinically relevant mechanisms of immune evasion.

Title: Multimodal pooled Perturb-CITE-seq screens in patient models define mechanisms of cancer immune evasion
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: In this study, the authors developed Perturb-CITE-sequencing (Perturb-CITE-seq), enabling pooled clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeat (CRISPR)–Cas9 perturbations with single-cell transcriptome and protein readouts. They profiled transcriptomes and 20 proteins in ~218,000 cells under ~750 perturbations associated with cancer cell-intrinsic immune checkpoint inhibitor resistance (ICR) in patient-derived melanoma cells and autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) co-cultures. This work provides a framework for the deciphering of complex mechanisms by large-scale perturbation screens with multimodal, single-cell readouts, and discovers potentially clinically relevant mechanisms of immune evasion.

Title: A Genome-wide Framework for Mapping Gene Regulation via Cellular Genetic Screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors present a multiplex, expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL)-inspired framework for mapping enhancer-gene pairs by introducing random combinations of CRISPR/Cas9-mediated perturbations to each of many cells, followed by scRNA-seq. Across two experiments, they used dCas9-KRAB to perturb 5,920 candidate enhancers with no strong a priori hypothesis as to their target gene(s) in a total of 254,974 cells. This framework will facilitate the large-scale mapping of enhancer-gene regulatory interactions, a critical yet largely uncharted component of the cis-regulatory landscape of the human genome.

Title: A Genome-wide Framework for Mapping Gene Regulation via Cellular Genetic Screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors present a multiplex, expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL)-inspired framework for mapping enhancer-gene pairs by introducing random combinations of CRISPR/Cas9-mediated perturbations to each of many cells, followed by scRNA-seq. Across two experiments, they used dCas9-KRAB to perturb 5,920 candidate enhancers with no strong a priori hypothesis as to their target gene(s) in a total of 254,974 cells. This framework will facilitate the large-scale mapping of enhancer-gene regulatory interactions, a critical yet largely uncharted component of the cis-regulatory landscape of the human genome.

Title: A Genome-wide Framework for Mapping Gene Regulation via Cellular Genetic Screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors present a multiplex, expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL)-inspired framework for mapping enhancer-gene pairs by introducing random combinations of CRISPR/Cas9-mediated perturbations to each of many cells, followed by scRNA-seq. Title: Highly multiplexed single-cell RNA-seq by DNA oligonucleotide tagging of cellular proteins
Tissues: mouse neural stem cells (human only for species mixing experiment)
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study describes a universal sample multiplexing method for single-cell RNA sequencing in which fixed cells are chemically labeled by attaching identifying DNA oligonucleotides to cellular proteins. They produced a 96-plex perturbation experiments consisting of a pair of drug-triples with 4 drugs in total at 3 or 4 different concentractions (2x4²x3).

Title: Profiling the genetic determinants of chromatin accessibility with scalable single-cell CRISPR screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors describe a CRISPR-based, single-cell combinatorial indexing assay for transposase-accessible chromatin (CRISPR–sciATAC) to link genetic perturbations to genome-wide chromatin accessibility in a large number of cells. In human myelogenous leukemia cells, they apply CRISPR–sciATAC to target 105 chromatin-related genes, generating chromatin accessibility data for ~30,000 single cells and correlate the loss of specific chromatin remodelers with changes in accessibility globally and at the binding sites of individual transcription factors (TFs).  CRISPR–sciATAC is a high-throughput, single-cell method for studying the effect of genetic perturbations on chromatin in normal and disease states.

Title: Profiling the genetic determinants of chromatin accessibility with scalable single-cell CRISPR screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors describe a CRISPR-based, single-cell combinatorial indexing assay for transposase-accessible chromatin (CRISPR–sciATAC) to link genetic perturbations to genome-wide chromatin accessibility in a large number of cells. In human myelogenous leukemia cells, they apply CRISPR–sciATAC to target 105 chromatin-related genes, generating chromatin accessibility data for ~30,000 single cells and correlate the loss of specific chromatin remodelers with changes in accessibility globally and at the binding sites of individual transcription factors (TFs).  CRISPR–sciATAC is a high-throughput, single-cell method for studying the effect of genetic perturbations on chromatin in normal and disease states.

Title: Multiplexed single-cell transcriptional response profiling to define cancer vulnerabilities and therapeutic mechanism of action
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors develop MIX-Seq, a method for multiplexed transcriptional profiling of post-perturbation responses across a mixture of samples with single-cell resolution, using SNP-based computational demultiplexing of single-cell RNA-sequencing data. They show that MIX-Seq can be used to profile responses to chemical or genetic perturbations across pools of 100 or more cancer cell lines and combine it with Cell Hashing to further multiplex additional experimental conditions, such as post-treatment time points or drug doses.

Title: Scalable, multimodal profiling of chromatin accessibility, gene expression and protein levels in single cells
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here they present ATAC with select antigen profiling by sequencing (ASAP-seq), a tool to simultaneously profile accessible chromatin and protein levels. It pairs sparse scATAC-seq data with robust detection of hundreds of cell surface and intracellular protein markers and optional capture of mitochondrial DNA for clonal tracking, capturing three distinct modalities in single cells. Together with DOGMA-seq, an adaptation of CITE-seq (cellular indexing of transcriptomes and epitopes by sequencing) for measuring gene activity across the central dogma of gene regulation, they apply their method to native hematopoietic differentiation and peripheral blood mononuclear cell stimulation (multiplexed perturbation).

Title: Exploring genetic interaction manifolds constructed from rich single-cell phenotypes
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors present an analytical framework for interpreting high-dimensional landscapes of cell states (manifolds) constructed from transcriptional phenotypes. They applied this approach to Perturb-seq profiling of strong genetic interactions (GIs) mined from a growth-based, gain-of-function GI map. Exploration of this manifold enabled ordering of regulatory pathways, principled classification of GIs (e.g., identifying suppressors), and mechanistic elucidation of synergistic interactions. Finally, they applied recommender system machine learning to predict interactions, facilitating exploration of vastly larger GI manifolds.

Title: Characterizing the molecular regulation of inhibitory immune checkpoints with multimodal single-cell screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors apply expanded CRISPR-compatible (EC)CITE-seq, a technology that combines pooled CRISPR screens with scRNA-seq and surface protein measurements, to explore the molecular networks that regulate PD-L1 expression. They also develop a computational framework, mixscape, that substantially improves the signal-to-noise ratio in single-cell perturbation screens by identifying and removing confounding sources of variation. Their results identify a new mechanism for the regulation of immune checkpoints and present a powerful analytical framework for the analysis of multimodal single-cell perturbation screens.

Title: Characterizing the molecular regulation of inhibitory immune checkpoints with multimodal single-cell screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors apply expanded CRISPR-compatible (EC)CITE-seq, a technology that combines pooled CRISPR screens with scRNA-seq and surface protein measurements, to explore the molecular networks that regulate PD-L1 expression. They also develop a computational framework, mixscape, that substantially improves the signal-to-noise ratio in single-cell perturbation screens by identifying and removing confounding sources of variation. Their results identify a new mechanism for the regulation of immune checkpoints and present a powerful analytical framework for the analysis of multimodal single-cell perturbation screens.

Title: Characterizing the molecular regulation of inhibitory immune checkpoints with multimodal single-cell screens

Title: Characterizing the molecular regulation of inhibitory immune checkpoints with multimodal single-cell screens
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors apply expanded CRISPR-compatible (EC)CITE-seq, a technology that combines pooled CRISPR screens with scRNA-seq and surface protein measurements, to explore the molecular networks that regulate PD-L1 expression. They also develop a computational framework, mixscape, that substantially improves the signal-to-noise ratio in single-cell perturbation screens by identifying and removing confounding sources of variation. Their results identify a new mechanism for the regulation of immune checkpoints and present a powerful analytical framework for the analysis of multimodal single-cell perturbation screens.

Title: High-throughput single-cell chromatin accessibility CRISPR screens enable unbiased identification of regulatory networks in cancer
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Chromatin accessibility profiling can identify putative regulatory regions genome wide; Spear-ATAC profiling of 104,592 cells representing 414 sgRNA knock-down populations combines CRISPR perturbation screening with scATAC-seq as joint measurement in the same cells. They use it to reveal the temporal dynamics of epigenetic responses to regulatory perturbations in cancer cells and the associations between transcription factor binding profiles.

Title: High-throughput single-cell chromatin accessibility CRISPR screens enable unbiased identification of regulatory networks in cancer
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Chromatin accessibility profiling can identify putative regulatory regions genome wide; Spear-ATAC profiling of 104,592 cells representing 414 sgRNA knock-down populations combines CRISPR perturbation screening with scATAC-seq as joint measurement in the same cells. They use it to reveal the temporal dynamics of epigenetic responses to regulatory perturbations in cancer cells and the associations between transcription factor binding profiles.

Title: High-throughput single-cell chromatin accessibility CRISPR screens enable unbiased identification of regulatory networks in cancer
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Chromatin accessibility profiling can identify putative regulatory regions genome wide; Spear-ATAC profiling of 104,592 cells representing 414 sgRNA knock-down populations combines CRISPR perturbation screening with scATAC-seq as joint measurement in the same cells. They use it to reveal the temporal dynamics of epigenetic responses to regulatory perturbations in cancer cells and the associations between transcription factor binding profiles.

Title: Mapping information-rich genotype-phenotype landscapes with genome-scale Perturb-seq
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors of this study perform genome-scale Perturb-seq targeting all expressed genes with CRISPR interference (CRISPRi) across >2.5 million human cells and present a framework to power biological discovery with the resulting genotype-phenotype map. They use transcriptional phenotypes to predict the function of poorly-characterized genes, uncovering new regulators of ribosome biogenesis, transcription, and mitochondrial respiration. In addition to assigning gene function, single-cell transcriptional phenotypes allow for in-depth dissection of complex cellular phenomena – from RNA processing to differentiation. They leverage this ability to systematically identify the genetic drivers and consequences of aneuploidy and to discover an unanticipated layer of stress-specific regulation of the mitochondrial genome.

Title: Mapping information-rich genotype-phenotype landscapes with genome-scale Perturb-seq
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors of this study perform genome-scale Perturb-seq targeting all expressed genes with CRISPR interference (CRISPRi) across >2.5 million human cells and present a framework to power biological discovery with the resulting genotype-phenotype map. They use transcriptional phenotypes to predict the function of poorly-characterized genes, uncovering new regulators of ribosome biogenesis, transcription, and mitochondrial respiration. Title: Optimal-Transport Analysis of Single-Cell Gene Expression Identifies Developmental Trajectories in Reprogramming
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study contains scRNA-seq datasets from exceptionally high-resolution timecourse experiments from embryonic mouse cells. There are two study arms with different media (phase-2) after an initial common arm (phase-1).

Title: Optimal-Transport Analysis of Single-Cell Gene Expression Identifies Developmental Trajectories in Reprogramming
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study contains scRNA-seq datasets from exceptionally high-resolution timecourse experiments from embryonic mouse cells. There are two study arms with different media (phase-2) after an initial common arm (phase-1).

Title: Targeted Perturb-seq enables genome-scale genetic screens in single cells
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This paper introduces targeted Perturb-seq (TAP-seq), a sensitive, inexpensive and platform-independent method focusing single-cell RNA-seq coverage on genes of interest. TAP-seq permits routine analysis of thousands of CRISPR-mediated perturbations within a single experiment, detects weak effects and lowly expressed genes, and decreases sequencing requirements by up to 50-fold. They apply TAP-seq to generate perturbation-based enhancer–target gene maps for 1,778 enhancers within 2.5% of the human genome.

Title: Targeted Perturb-seq enables genome-scale genetic screens in single cells
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This paper introduces targeted Perturb-seq (TAP-seq), a sensitive, inexpensive and platform-independent method focusing single-cell RNA-seq coverage on genes of interest. TAP-seq permits routine analysis of thousands of CRISPR-mediated perturbations within a single experiment, detects weak effects and lowly expressed genes, and decreases sequencing requirements by up to 50-fold. They apply TAP-seq to generate perturbation-based enhancer–target gene maps for 1,778 enhancers within 2.5% of the human genome.

Title: Genome-wide CRISPR Screens in Primary Human T Cells Reveal Key Regulators of Immune Function
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Large-scale CRISPR screens have been challenging in primary human cells, which is why the authors of this study developed a new method, single guide RNA (sgRNA) lentiviral infection with Cas9 protein electroporation (SLICE), and use it to identify regulators of stimulation responses in primary human T cells. Targeted ablation of individual candidate genes characterized hits and identified perturbations that enhanced cancer cell killing. SLICE coupled with single-cell RNA sequencing (RNA-seq) revealed signature stimulation-response gene programs altered by key genetic perturbations. The SLICE platform enables unbiased discovery and characterization of functional gene targets in primary cells.

Title: Massively multiplex chemical transcriptomics at single-cell resolution
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study introduces “sci-Plex,” which uses “nuclear hashing” to quantify global transcriptional responses to thousands of independent perturbations at single-cell resolution. They applied sci-Plex to screen three cancer cell lines exposed to 188 compounds, profiling ~650,000 single-cell transcriptomes across ~5000 independent samples in one experiment. The results reveal substantial intercellular heterogeneity in response to specific compounds, commonalities in response to families of compounds, and insight into differential properties within families.

Title: Massively multiplex chemical transcriptomics at single-cell resolution
Tissues: A549 (lung adenocarcinoma), K562 (chronic myelogenous leukemia), and MCF7 (mammary adenocarcinoma)
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study introduces “sci-Plex,” which uses “nuclear hashing” to quantify global transcriptional responses to thousands of independent perturbations at single-cell resolution. They applied sci-Plex to screen three cancer cell lines exposed to 188 compounds, profiling ~650,000 single-cell transcriptomes across ~5000 independent samples in one experiment. The results reveal substantial intercellular heterogeneity in response to specific compounds, commonalities in response to families of compounds, and insight into differential properties within families.

Title: Massively multiplex chemical transcriptomics at single-cell resolution
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study introduces “sci-Plex,” which uses “nuclear hashing” to quantify global transcriptional responses to thousands of independent perturbations at single-cell resolution. They applied sci-Plex to screen three cancer cell lines exposed to 188 compounds, profiling ~650,000 single-cell transcriptomes across ~5000 independent samples in one experiment. Title: CRISPR Interference-Based Platform for Multimodal Genetic Screens in Human iPSC-Derived Neurons
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors describe a CRISPR interference (CRISPRi)-based platform for genetic screens in healthy human neurons derived from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) and demonstrate robust and durable knockdown of endogenous genes. The study presents three complementary genetic screens: a survival-based screen, a screen with scRNA-seq uncovering several examples of genes whose knockdown had strikingly cell-type-specific consequences, and lastly a longitudinal imaging screen detecting distinct consequences of gene knockdown on neuronal morphology.

Title: CRISPR Interference-Based Platform for Multimodal Genetic Screens in Human iPSC-Derived Neurons
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors describe a CRISPR interference (CRISPRi)-based platform for genetic screens in healthy human neurons derived from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) and demonstrate robust and durable knockdown of endogenous genes. The study presents three complementary genetic screens: a survival-based screen, a screen with scRNA-seq uncovering several examples of genes whose knockdown had strikingly cell-type-specific consequences, and lastly a longitudinal imaging screen detecting distinct consequences of gene knockdown on neuronal morphology.

Title: Genome-wide CRISPRi/a screens in human neurons link lysosomal failure to ferroptosis
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors present the first genome-wide CRISPR interference and CRISPR activation screens in human neurons, uncovering pathways controlling neuronal response to chronic oxidative stress. They also determine transcriptomic changes in neurons after perturbation of genes linked to neurodegenerative diseases. To enable the systematic comparison of gene function across different human cell types, they further establish a data commons named CRISPRbrain.

Title: Genome-wide CRISPRi/a screens in human neurons link lysosomal failure to ferroptosis
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Here, the authors present the first genome-wide CRISPR interference and CRISPR activation screens in human neurons, uncovering pathways controlling neuronal response to chronic oxidative stress. They also determine transcriptomic changes in neurons after perturbation of genes linked to neurodegenerative diseases. To enable the systematic comparison of gene function across different human cell types, they further establish a data commons named CRISPRbrain.

Title: Lineage tracing on transcriptional landscapes links state to fate during differentiation
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: The authors developed a tool called LARRY (lineage and RNA recovery) that clonally tags cells with DNA barcodes that can be read using scRNASeq, overcoming the destructive nature of single cell measurements and enabeling insights into how variation in transcriptional state biases future cell fate. In one experiment, they apply LARRY to mouse embryonic stem cells under different cytokine conditions across time.

Title: Multiplexed engineering and analysis of endogenous enhancer activity in single cells
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: Mosaic-seq is introduced as a method to systematically perturb enhancers and measure their endogenous activities at single-cell resolution. Mosaic-seq uses a CRISPR barcoding system to jointly measure a cell’s transcriptome and its sgRNA modulators, thus quantifying the effects of dCas9-KRAB-mediated enhancer repression in single cells. Applying Mosaic-seq to 71 constituent enhancers from 15 super-enhancers, this analysis of 51,448 sgRNA-induced transcriptomes finds that only a small number of constituents are major effectors of target gene expression.

Title: Deconvolution of Cell Type-Specific Drug Responses in Human Tumor Tissue with Single-Cell RNA-seq
Mini-Abstract (loosely summarized origin: This study combines multiplexed drug perturbation in acute slice culture from freshly resected tumors with scRNA-seq to profile transcriptome-wide drug responses in individual patients. They applied this approach to drug perturbations on slices derived from six glioblastoma (GBM) resections to identify conserved drug responses and to one additional GBM resection to identify patient-specific responses, demonstrating that acute slice cultures recapitulate the cellular and molecular features of the originating tumor tissue and the feasibility of drug screening from an individual tumor.
